name: Åbo Akademi University
goal: Åbo Akademi University (ÅAU) in Turku, Finland, is an internationally acknowledged research university with an extensive responsibility for preserving the Swedish educational and cultural heritage as the only Swedish-speaking multidisciplinary university in Finland. The recent adoption and further development of the four strategic research areas (Minority Studies, Molecular Process and Material Technology, Drug Development and Diagnostics, and the Sea profile), has allowed ÅAU to focus on major national and European projects, as well as reinforce its status as a bridge between Finland and other Nordic states, advancing scientific collaboration in a variety of highly relevant research areas.
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Environment, External Relations, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: Major pan-European financial instruments, and in particular, Horizon (Horizon Europe)
